intro: Hirtella bullata, commonly known as the hairy hirtella, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has a compact shrub form with hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hirtella bullata is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
